item.title: Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Space
item.description: 1 Linear Operators Definition 1 (Linear operator) Let \(\mathcal F\) and \(\mathcal G\) be normed vector spaces over \(\reals\). A function \(A \colon \mathcal F \to \mathcal G\) is called a linear operator if it satisfies the following properties: Honogeneity: For any \(α \in \reals\) and \(f \in \mathcal F\), \(A(αf) = α (Af)\). Additivity: For any \(f,g \in \mathcal F\), \(A(f + g) = Af + Ag\).
